Dear Vladimir

- JavaME and JavaSE don't have the same api

if you don't use rms nor lcdui and the connectors but only
packages that belongs to business-logic you face a subset of J2SE.
an that's intendet.
So if you run functional tests (not syntax, so if you first comile on a kvm
even float are not allowed) they will work the same as on j2se.

(didnt try it, i say it only to question if you REALLY need j2meUnit for
functional testing buisness logic?)

Maybe Brain can tell me what he thinks about this too. I understand his
position to separate business logic from the device specific code,
but on J2ME you have to fight agains severe resource restrictions and you
hav to keep your code tight.

- testing on an emulator is not enough, because your application won't
be used in an emulator

-> you *must* test your application in the environment it will be used.
     You can use a simulator to ease the testing process but running in
a simulator is not a proof that the application will still run on the
J2ME environment.  The final 'Fail/Pass' status will be decided on that
environment, not on an simulator.

that's what I say: use a MIDlet Wrapper for j2meUnit and add it to your
Suite , now you can test on a real device.

thanks
roland
